website_summaries.verdict: This entry-level device doesn't have every sensor a weather buff would want, but it displays plenty of useful info on a large LCD.
pros: LCD monitor displays a surprising amount of weather data
cons: RF connection between sensors and base difficult to maintain

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this crap. This is the second one I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this crap.This is the second one I have owned. The first one failed in about 14 months. I thought it was a fluke, so bought another in Oct 2016, which is now failing. Even while working, the thing devours batteries, and the procedure for replacing them is far from plug n play. You must remove the batteries from all stations and transmitters (I have two of each), wait 60 seconds, then replace them in one transmitter, then in both receivers within 30 seconds, etc... The two transmitters are in two different places in my yard, and the receivers are in two different places in my house. Replacing batteries every 3-4 months is annoying and a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Red Wolf

customer_reviews.title: if it only worked...
customer_reviews.text: the first one stopped working after a year when the outside sensor stopped working. i liked the idea while it worked and maybe the outside sensor got wet. So I bought it again. Setting up the replacement outside sensor worked fine, but the indoor temp was stuck at 76 degrees. no amount of troubleshooting according to the manual did anything. And don't expect a response from Lacrosse. Also the auto time set feature didn't work. i'd give it 5 stars when it works, but defective units and non-support from Lacrosse is barely worth 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Klein

customer_reviews.title: For the THIRD time I purchased this indoor/outdoor thermometer and ...
customer_reviews.text: For the THIRD time I purchased this indoor/outdoor thermometer and it worked until the batteries needed replacing. It has not worked since! I replaced the batteries in the base unit as well as the remote sensor with brand new batteries and all I get is the inside temp. The outside temp. shows only dashes, no temp. This has happened on ALL THREE units that I've purchased. The maddening thing is that ALL THREE times this has happened, the warranty is expired by about 6 months. No more! If I need to know how cold it is outside, I'll just go outside and check. I don't have the money to keep buying these things that don't last past 18 months!
customer_reviews.author: Ebudua

customer_reviews.title: Really Disappointed With the Lack of Accuracy...
customer_reviews.text: I had a La Crosse weather station for years and it worked very well until it died recently. So naturally, I purchased another La Crosse (WS9160U-IT) to replace it and it turned out to be VERY INACCURATE! So, I figured that maybe I received a defective unit and returned it for a new one. But the 2nd replacement also turned out to be very inaccurate. (I am willing to accept ±2 degrees off. Up to 8 or 10 degrees off is absolutely unacceptable.) A weather station without accuracy is pointless. These were not my first weather stations and all the set up (and reset) procedures were followed carefully. Both were returned and I will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Is it to read thermostat.
customer_reviews.text: Replace my old The mometer with this newer easy to read version. I like it better than the other because I can read it from across the RV. The letters are large enough To read from far away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a few days and then failed to pick up outside temperature. The outdoor reception signal icon initially comes on but no outside temp shows up. Then the icon goes off. Although the batteries tested well into the green, I put new batteries in both the transmitter and receiver. The RX icon still comes on, indicating that the batteries are low.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermometer If You Don't Have Problems With It
customer_reviews.text: I have used this item to see what the ambient temperature is outside my house. It has worked well for a while, but when I replaced the batteries last wee, I could not get the transmitter and receiver to pair. I called LaCrosse Technology twice for help. I never got to speak to anyone and had to leave my telephone number. No one ever called me back. I now have two pieces of junk. This item is fine when it works. However, the lack of support when a problem arose is very disappointing. I am about to buy another one and it won''t be LaCrosse.
customer_reviews.author: John P Brady

customer_reviews.title: No Backlight.
customer_reviews.text: The product works well and looks good but has no backlight. I have never encountered a digital display that didn't have a light. I bought this to replace a really old clock/thermometer with a wired sensor, made by Oregon Scientific. It actually still works but the wire, exposed to the elements for all these years deteriorated and fell apart. But, it least it had a light. I have just rewired it and will place it back in my bathroom, next to the window, where I can push a button to illuminate the screen to see the temperature outside. I'm disappointed in LaCrosse for not including illumination.
customer_reviews.author: Sniklu

customer_reviews.title: It works but bumps over and shuts off
customer_reviews.text: I like knowing what the temperature is right outside my house. This gadget is good for that. I had two of these that I threw away, thinking I’d get another one because I was having some issues with them working I had two of these that I threw away, thinking I’d get another one because I was having some issues with them working. Now I think I should’ve been more patient. This design is really terrible. I will not buy another one because it collapses too easily. I do not like the other ones I’m seeing online with more features, because they are designed the same way.
customer_reviews.author: toodles233

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this stupid thing works properly!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for about 4 days now and I think the outside reading is way off. It's always showing the temperature as being about 10 - 15 degrees higher than what my local weather is saying. I have it positioned on my balcony on the back side of a cross beam underneath the overhanging roof. Plenty of shade with no sunlight ever biting the transmitter. I bought this product so I could have a more accurate tempatue reading but it seems it's just going to end up being an ugly clock. Not happy
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Colangelo

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in LaCrosse
customer_reviews.text: I never had a chance to use this product. Have used Lacrosse thermometers for over 20 years with no issues but this one must be a lemon. Followed the directions that came with the product and also further directions online. I performed the instructions over and over many times but the outside temp just would not appear. Calling LaCrosse was a joke! After sitting on hold on at least 3 different occasions I received the standard “your call is important to us” spiel and was assured I would be called back but it NEVER happened. So I am returning this and will think twice before purchasing from Lacrosse again.
customer_reviews.author: Frenchie mom

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple Weather Station
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine three years and have been looking for a more complex La Crosse station (I had VERY bad luck with AccuRite devices and its customer support). I saw some poor reviews of the La Crosse color ones, which concerned me. So I thought I'd check out reviews of this one. Same thing, some unhappy reviewers. All I can say is I've had mine three years, I just had to change the batteries on both parts, accuracy is good, controls are easy to use (granted, it's a simple device), no complaints. I guess I'll try a fancier one.
customer_reviews.author: Olddude

customer_reviews.title: An encore device to replace the same reader
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace a previous thermometer that stopped working. I have been very happy with the design and function of this model. The numbers are good size to be read from several feet away, the outdoor reading is especially appreciated in the summer here in the Central Valley of California. Today's temp is threateningly close to 100! Good to know if I want to ge out for errancx. Only hitch: mounting the outside device is a very tight to get in the mount that came with it. It should be tight so it will not come loose easily but it is a challenge for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Lehnen

customer_reviews.title: Good, but remote sensor unreliable
customer_reviews.text: A nice size, attractive, and reasonably accurate. I'd buy another. I recommend using quality lithium AAAs, such as Energizer Ultimates. The two downsides: a) the display can be difficult to read at an angle. So you should experiment before placing it on a wall. You'll want it close to eye level for your most common reading position. b) as others have noted, the accompanying outdoor sensor (TX29U-IT 915 MHz Wireless Temperature Sensor) is unreliable. My first one lasted only eight months. Fresh batteries, performing all the setup steps, etc. were to no avail. A replacement sensor worked with no fuss or drama.
customer_reviews.author: mazomv

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working in 3 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: Thermometer no longer reads outside temperature. Quit working after 3 weeks. Replaced batteries and was working for less that 24 hours and again quit reading outside temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Shire6

customer_reviews.title: It seems that it is not returnable at this point which is very annoying since it lasted only about 7 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in April to replace two other thermometers that broke. I could not remember when I bought the other two, but I was willing to imagine that it had been "awhile". One of the new thermometers is still working but the other no longer reports the temperature outdoors. It seems that it is not returnable at this point which is very annoying since it lasted only about 7 months. I will not be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Bryn meehan

customer_reviews.title: Remote missing the battery cover and will not connect
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today. The remote unit is missing the battery holding panel. Everything else was in the box but the back panel is missing. Even with batteries in the remote it is not connecting to the unit. I followed the instructions, first putting batteries int he remote (without being able to put on the cover) and then putting them in the display unit. I tried two different sets of batteries so I know that is not the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Morrill

customer_reviews.title: Very Difficult to Set Up, Does Not Stay Synced
customer_reviews.text: This product has an outdoor component that reads the outdoor temperature and then broadcasts it to the indoor component. The directions are pretty good, and when I follow them the inside and outside components will sync. But, after a few days or two weeks, the indoor component stops syncing with the outdoor piece, and I need to re-initiate everything, about a 10 minute chore. Really, it shouldn't be this hard! I'm going to throw this away and get a thermometer made by different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jan B.

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: I am going to keep this simple - Eats batteries like a maniac - Setting up and resetting procedures are ridiculous and don't work most of the time. I don't have words to describe how unacceptable the "connecting to the sensor" and "reset" procedures are. Especially in 2020. - And you are forced to do it every three months because the units eat batteries. Don't buy it. I have three for several years now and regret ever buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product - just installed my 3rd unit
customer_reviews.text: I have had these units for years and just installed my third one. My homes are in a very cold climate and I am amazed hos these units performed. Most important thing is to use good, strong batteries on the outdoor sensor so you are sure to get maximum transmission distance. I simply believe these are a GREAT value.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks, warranty seems useless
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying these. They work well when they work, but they frequently stop working. There is a recovery process, supposed to bring them back to life, but it doesn't work for me. I decided to buy another because there is the option of a warranty. The warranty text came in e-mail, and it is LONG, complex, and the wording seems to say they will do everything in their power not to pay off. I would include it but it would exceed Amazon's text limit. Larger Lacrosse units have worked well for me, but not this small one. If anyone knows of a reliable equivalent, Ill try it when this one breaks, as it surely will.
customer_reviews.author: Lyman W. Lyon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice with a few exceptions.
customer_reviews.text: I have several digital weather stations, and this one reads 1-2 degrees cooler than it should. No way to adjust the temp up. Also, it lacks the time of max/min temps. What I have found from my other instruments is that the sensor determines whether the temps read high or low, the unit itself just reports what the sensor sends out. It's very easy to use and very easy to see - attractive, looks great. Just wish it was more accurate and I miss the simple time of min, time of max feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second LaCrosse
customer_reviews.text: Our first one crapped out, so we needed a replacement. We find having this unit super handy to check the temps throughout the year (inside & out) but especially summer and winter. Just a quick look at the unit and at anytime gives us an update of the temps. We usually have to pick it up to read it, but that may be cuz we're older. The posted temps on the weather apps such as weather.com are usually a little off from our actual location.
customer_reviews.author: Shortimer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the La Crosse indoor/outdoor temperature gauge, until you read this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this temperature gauge 15 months ago, ignoring the comments about its unreliability. I should have listened! When this thermometer works, it works fine, but it doesn't work consistently or when I really need it, and it has been this way from the start. The display almost always reads the time and the indoor temp, it is the outdoor temp (what I most need) that is only displayed about 50% of the time. It also eats through batteries - I am getting about 3 months out of the batteries in both the remote sensor and the base unit. I think you can do better than this product -- buy something else!
customer_reviews.author: cdt

customer_reviews.title: Works greatr!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. We had one in our house for several years, and then when we moved to this current (temporary) apartment as part of downsizing, we did without. But decided it would be nice to have again, so purchased this one (not sure what the other one was). Love this one because the clock is big enough to see from my reading chair. And it's simple -- just a clock and and outdoor and indoor temperature. Works great. It does take a day for it to fully capture the outside temperature. We mounted the outside part under an eave as suggested and it seems a perfect place. I will always have one of these in my house from now on.
customer_reviews.author: wonder time

customer_reviews.title: quit working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I have done everything suggested in the manual that came with it and the outdoor sensor will no work even if it is sitting right next to the main unit. Sorry I spent the money. Odd that my friend who recommended it to me said his worked for 3 years and now has quit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works through several walls and looks better than those plastic ones. Like the Max / Min feature
customer_reviews.text: A good looking case that looks like an instrument and not another white plastic gizmo. Works through several walls in a big city with lots of air wave interference. Unexpected benefit was the max min setting. Accidentally left refrigerated mac and cheese in the car for a week and could check how warm it had gotten in the last week to decide whether food was safe to eat. It hit 87 so NO.
customer_reviews.author: PageTurner

customer_reviews.title: add contact grease
customer_reviews.text: i love this indoor outdoor thermometer (have 6 over the years) but in less than a year the outdoor unit would stop reading. The 2 in LR stop reading this week, i had 0x-Gard (electric contact grease) so why not try, I put it on contacts and battery and wow they work again. I had jest through an old one that didn't work in the garbage so I dug it out greased it and it works again. Try it.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Basic Station.
customer_reviews.text: It was quite a challenge to find a weather station that didn't have a huge color display and would work on battery-power alone. This is a fine replacement for the station I had been using since 1997. The remote station was easy to place outdoors. The clock is big and easy to read from a reasonable distance. The temperatures are accurate within a degree. There is no back-light, but mine is placed in a well lighted room. Also, this guy is not on the "internet of things" as it uses no wi-fi.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamon Bark

customer_reviews.title: This item is JUNK, purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.text: Junk, The outdoor sending unit had problems. When I talked to the woman at their office she said that the outdoor sending unit should not get wet or be exposed to moisture. Where is that possible, in the Mohave desert? I was told that I could purchase a plastic shield for $20, nearly the price of the unit. She also said that they only last about 3 years. Planned obsolescence.
customer_reviews.author: John Brash

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy counts -- even through the walls.
customer_reviews.text: We positioned our thermometer in our bedroom, which requires the outside signal to travel through two walls and a door for a total distance of about ł5 feet. So despite the obstacles, the temperature is accurate compared with TV and radio reports. Large, easy-to-read numbers without cluttering me with more info than I need, such as barometric pressure, moon phase and humidity.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Durability issues.
customer_reviews.text: Two issues for me, one small, one big. The small: The outdoor sensor always seems to overstate the temperature in warmer weather. Tried moving it around to make sure it is not in the direct sunlight but it still seems to put the outside temperature at least 5-10 degrees too high in the heat of the day between June and October. That would have still earned four stars. But, the big: the receiver, which displays the readings, unit went complete dead 18 months after purchase. Tried fresh batteries but there is no display at all. One year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: S.J. Häsler

customer_reviews.title: Works well on batteries only
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my golf cart because there is no way to plug it into power. Both units work on batteries and it's fairly accurate. I like having the sensor outside my cart which is enclosed and the main screen inside the cart registering the temp inside. The first version by the same company that costs $10 did not give a constant reading of the outside temp but this $20 version works perfectly well. It's very fairly priced as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: D Darlington

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I love being able to read multiple remote sensors in one place. One of the remote temperature sensors lets me monitor the temperature of a large locker I use for paint storage. The locker is outside. I don't want the paint to freeze in winter. This system has been great for easily checking the temperature in that paint locker without opening the locker. Good thing, too, because the heater failed once. With this digital indoor/ outdoor thermometer I was able to spot the problem and save the paint. Extra sensors:
customer_reviews.author: Terrence WalshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor Temp will not work after you change batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item twice and both times after they batteries need to be replaced the unit will not be in sync with the remote therefore the outdoor temperature no longer reads. Complete waste of $30. I will be returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: Best Thermostat for Sulcata Tortoise Owners
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best thermostat products for owners of a sulcata tortoise. I use this to keep track of the temperature in my sulcata tortiose's shed. The thermostat stays right next to my bed where I can check the temperature every morning, night and during the day. It helps to ease my mind during a storm or when there is a possible day of extreme weather.
customer_reviews.author: Eloradanan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, although setup is a bit confusing.
customer_reviews.text: Performs as advertised and works well. My wife likes having it sitting on her kitchen counter where she can see the outside temps at a glance. Setup is somewhat confusing, and I had to hit the product web site to get it working. The video on the web site clearly shows how to get it right. The key? When you first set it up, the sending unit must be at least three feet away from the display. The batteries for the sending unit MUST be inserted first. And the display MUST be inserted within about 30 seconds after the sending unit. With that caveat, it is a nice product. Be sure to read the Ward Wagher novels at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ward Wagher

customer_reviews.title: Display faded out in 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Neat little gizmo. Not expensive enough to try for return or refund. Worked for about 3 days then the display started fading. Thought maybe I had put some old batteries in it so I bought fresh top shelf batteries and tried that.... nope. The display got weaker and weaker until it was completely blank within about 2 weeks. Probably just a defective unit but the next one I get won't be another one of these. Just thought I should let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Gnomie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a home that had an older version set up in it. We loved it and it worked great for 2 years (it was much older than that) and when it stopped, I immediately bought the same one to replace it. Easy to follow instructions to set it up. Only thing is it takes time for the temperatures to get really accurate the first time. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: J&E

customer_reviews.title: We've had good luck with our LaCrosse weather station
customer_reviews.text: We've had good luck with our LaCrosse weather station. Had the first one for years but never had a really good spot for the transmitter so it took a beating and finally quit after one too many wind gusts blew it away for the umpteenth and final time. But we had learned good and well how to reset it so we've replaced it with the same one as the old since we already know how to set it up, which wasn't easy in the beginning. The figures are as clear as the photo so it's easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Lolly

customer_reviews.title: it has come in very handy in my new apartment
customer_reviews.text: I am living in a senior apartment with a "thermostat" intended to make the residents feel like they have control over the temperature, with this device I can prove that the temperature never changes, I bought if for the humidity meter to grow mushrooms, it worked well in that capacity as well. I have no way of knowing how accurate it is or if it's weatherproof.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Bennatti

customer_reviews.title: Connects with old one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the house I bought already had one and I lost the sensor under the deck. Instead of buying a new sensor I opted to pay slightly more for a new one entirely. This works great! I have one sensor that sends info to two receivers (one in the bedroom nd one in the kitchen. This should be an option for customers...
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected and a good price
customer_reviews.text: If you just want basic current weather information (mainly temperature) this unit is a good buy. However, note that it's range (distance between transmitter and receiver) does decrease significantly if the signal has to pass through multiple walls, windows, etc. I have the receiver sitting on my bedroom dresser and ended up mounting the transmitter outside a window in the same room to get a reliable signal.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Sorry La Crosse Technology
customer_reviews.text: The outside temp is off 10-12 degrees, too high. I have located the sensor as instructed on a north facing side of the house under the edge of the garage where it is protected from rain. I emailed La Crosse two weeks ago and have not heard from them. If that is the best they can do for customer service then they certainly don't deserve anything better than one star. simple to set up and install; other than that, it does not reflect accurate
customer_reviews.author: sharon cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing value & customer service
customer_reviews.text: My three previous indoor/outdoor thermometers from this company performed well, so I bought a fourth. I thought the trouble I experienced was due to bad batteries (instructions warn about this), but after 10 months and three sets of batteries I contacted the company. After a two week delay I got a confused answer; after a followup email, the only option they offered was to buy a replacement sensor, so I bought a better device made by ThermoPro. UPDATE: I just got an email promising a replacement sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. The outdoor unit never will marry with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. The outdoor unit never will marry with the inside unit. The mounting bracket was for another model. I have not been able to get the outside or inside to pair and the only instructions given our to remove the batteries if they do not and I believe I actually got the wrong part that matches the brain to the unit. Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: William Weatherell

customer_reviews.title: Pick another product
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase of this product and for the second time the same failure has occurred. After about a year the outside temperature accuracy falls off dramatically. At lower temps (40-60’s) all is well, once the outside temps reach the 70s and above the system seems to add anywhere from 5 to 10 degrees to the actual temperature. Yes, I replaced the batteries. Yes, it’s in the shade all day on the north side of our house. Yes, it’s away from any other sources of heat. It’s just not very accurate over the expected operating range. Spend your $ on something else
customer_reviews.author: T Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Worse, you'll be faced with this frustration twice a ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY • I have just returned this item for refund after more than an hour of extreme frustration, including several visits to the Lacrosse support site, which includes a video. I was unable to set the time despite many attempts. There is no excuse for making a simple task complex or, in my case, impossible. Worse, you'll be faced with this frustration twice a year with spring and daylight savings changes. For shame to launch such faulty firmware/software on a trusting public. Meanwhile, three cheers for Amazon's absolutely brilliant system of quick and simple returns.
customer_reviews.author: Frederic Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Two and a half years...update
customer_reviews.text: Purchased August 2017...just replaced batteries for the first time today...transmitter device outside has survived below freezing weather and heat up to 110' and still going strong...outside of the durability of this devise what surprised me was that the batteries lasted almost 2 1/2 years...the batteries were still running the device but the display was very dim...device is worth the price...expecting to see this perform for me for another 2 1/2 years...thanks to La Crosse for providing a high quality product......M. Kinnison
customer_reviews.author: malcolm kinnison

customer_reviews.title: 13 month life - too short.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on November 15th 2015. December 19th 2016 led had blank spots and I cannot read the time. 35 days past the warranty period is a bit lame. This is the 3rd La Crosse unit I have owned. Purchased this to replace a 8 year old one that batteries leaked. I will most likely buy it again, but this one did not last long.
customer_reviews.author: greg rollins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Success!
customer_reviews.text: Having read other reviews, I inserted the batteries judiciously. 1 in the sensor, 1 in the base. 2nd in the sensor, 2nd in the base. There was no more than 5 seconds delay from the finishing the sensor to finishing the base station. PERFECT success! All displays worked within 20 seconds. Set the clock, and away we go! Yes, there is a little difference between the initial temperature readouts, but what's one or two degrees between friends. WAY easier to read than our previous (and more expensive) AcuRite which died from being splashed when cleaning the porch. We'll try not to splash this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jack  Berry

customer_reviews.title: Outside temperature is unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought two indoor/outdoor thermometers (this and the Acurite 01136M) for redundancy and comparison. The Acurite seems to do very well: its readings are always plausible and consistent with earlier thermometers which I still have around. The La Crosse, however, at sporadic intervals starts giving ridiculous (e.g., 10 degrees F. too high) outside temps. The first time that happened, I was able to coax it back to reasonableness by considerable fiddling (punching buttons, removing and reinserting batteries) over a period of time. It happened again and I was unable to "coax" it back. A call to their tech support was futile.
customer_reviews.author: outlier

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but only lasted for 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: It is accurate and easy to read but the outside transmitter stopped working after 3 years. I am debating weather (pun intended) to buy a new one or just use my iPhone for outside temp. The previous one lasted about 3 years also so that seems to be the lifespan of them in Northern California.
customer_reviews.author: EnjoyLife2016

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last a full year
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even last a full year. I had the sensor mounted under our eves out of direct weather, and the instrument panel mounted on our dining room wall. In the first 6 months it started losing the outside temperature. I replaced the batteries, it lasted 5 more months and started doing the same thing. Now replacing the batteries does not make any difference. Landfill!
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Its been working fine but I had to replace the batteries recently and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for 11 months now. Its been working fine but I had to replace the batteries recently and could not get the outside sensor to work. After contacting the warranty department they had me remove all batteries for fifteen minutes, press a button twenty times (literally) then put the batteries back in. It came back to life. We will see how much life it has. I like the size and the display. I question its longevity.
customer_reviews.author: coffii_howz

customer_reviews.title: Just right!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year when I realized just how cold it was going to get in the winters around here: not very! It doesn't break freezing more than a couple of nights a year, which means that it's running weather all year round. But once it drops below 50°F what you're wearing makes a difference... This has been perfect for my purposes all year long. Reliable and easy to read, setup was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not well
customer_reviews.text: 2 Stars because it works, until recently. There are two main issues with this thermometer. First, no backlight. That's in the description, but it's still annoying. Second, in order to sync the Outdoor thermometer with the base unit, you have to remove the batteries from the base unit. There is no option for syncing through the menu, you have to turn the entire thing off and then back on again. Which means you have to completely reset the clock, etc. Frustrating and very poor design.
customer_reviews.author: DrSergeant

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a little over 6 months now and I've haven't had any problems with it at all. Once you find the proper place to put the transmitter and then get it all set up there's no issues at least I haven't had any. it seems to be accurate within two to three degrees for outside Temps. Can inside temps has been 100% on. So I don't think you can beat it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Cieplj

customer_reviews.title: Base Unit Did Not Recognize Sensor Unit
customer_reviews.text: Used lithium batteries for the outside sensor as they have more cold tolerance. Used alkaline batteries for the receiver. The base unit would not recognize the outdoor sensor placed 6" from each other. All fresh batteries were used. Removed batteries several times to no avail. Requested replacement. We will have to wait for a second determination when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: David256

customer_reviews.title: Purchased used from Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: Station will not connect to remote outside unit. Proper setup procedure repeated several times. Returned and ordered replacement which worked properly. Own several of these devices, obviously they work very well except sometimes when resold as used., then you are taking a chance to save money!
customer_reviews.author: Woodsman

customer_reviews.title: Poor replacement for their previous model
customer_reviews.text: Compared to previous models of La Crosse wireless thermometers, this one is very disappointing. Range is about 50 feet consistently, despite a clear line-of-sight between the transmitter and the receiver, located by a window and several combinations of fresh batteries. My previous model handled this same location without any problem. Too bad these manufacturers always seem to cheapen up a product until it no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: Reality Check

customer_reviews.title: This product works well so far. I had another ...
customer_reviews.text: This product works well so far. I had another La Crosse outdoor weather station for a few years but this past weekend the outdoor sensor was ruined in a massive thunderstorm. This time, I made sure to mount the weather sensor holder to the side of the house. I used some nails, rather than the screws provided, as the screws provided didn't work too well. The weather station I had previously had a larger display and showed at all times the all time max and low temperatures. I miss having those features on this one. I have had to move this one on to the coffee table as the numbers can be difficult to see from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: dREW

customer_reviews.title: 7 out of 5 stars?  You should be able to do that.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second La Crosse Technology wireless thermometer. Our first one lasted over 10 years (as a guess) and finally stopped working after we dropped the sender down the basement stairs (it was on a decoration we were moving to decorate for the holidays). This is a nearly identical replacement, but with a bigger inside unit and has always done well for us. I can't recommend it more highly or I would.
customer_reviews.author: Gary E. Shay, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate outdoor readings
customer_reviews.text: In a mountain climate where 40° degree swings within 24 hours are normal, this has been consistently inaccurate. Upwards of 50 degrees it is reliable, but when the temps drop below freezing this unit is invariably off by 3 to 7 degrees when checked against multiple mercury thermometers.
customer_reviews.author: RCW

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor sensor/communications keeps failing
customer_reviews.text: While the indoor thermometer works fine, I really wanted it so that I could see the outdoor temperature inside. That part didn't work right out of the box. I called, and someone helped me get it working, and now, a few months later, it has stopped working again. I went online and found reset instructions, which didn't work (I tried it 3 times). I will call again, and hope that this time they will simply replace it, as I don't want to have to keep dealing with this.
customer_reviews.author: Eehawk

customer_reviews.title: Basic and easy to read
customer_reviews.text: We didn't need all of the bells and whistles on other weather stations. This is very simple and isn't large to be on a side table in our family room but it is still very easy to see the large numbers. It is exactly what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Could not get unit to pick up outside air temp unless the transmitter was in the same room. As soon as I moved the sender outside it lost the signal. After five battery down resets, and changing to new Duracell batteries still the same result until it finally just stopped working altogether, in that it would not receive a signal under any circumstances. Got a refund from Amazon, tossed it into the recycling bin.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Toedter

customer_reviews.title: Any moisture prevents reading
customer_reviews.text: I like the easy readability and simplicity of this unit. I do not like the fact that any moisture, rain, even the morning dew, results in the outside temperature NOT transmitting to the base unit. I am disappointed in this because I need to know the outside temperature in the morning before I leave for the day. I am considering returning the unit if I cannot find a "work around".
customer_reviews.author: K. T. Fletch

customer_reviews.title: When they work they are awesome. We have best luck using them in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry. I have several of these. Not much luck...Just don't seem to last. When they work they are awesome. We have best luck using them in the barns and they read in the house that is about 50 feet away. I live on the ocean and outdoor use is not good. Wind and salt eat them right up. We love the concept though. I can monitor the animals stalls in the Winter and hot summers which I appreciate having.
customer_reviews.author: kim T

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit and found I needed a second indoor reader and tried contacting the manufacturer. The leaflet instructions included with the digital thermometer has their contact information. Over a period of 2 weeks I left 2 voice messages and one email to get assistance and to find out if 2 indoor readers can be used with the outdoor sensor. I received No calls. No emails. No Customer Service. That's not acceptable, in my opinion. Buy knowing you may have absolutely no support.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value - Great product - VERY ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: I must say that for the price, this digital weather station sure does the job! The display is very bright and extremely precise when it comes to temps inside the home and outside. I have the wireless remote outside of my dining room window (the north side of my home - which is where you will get the most accurate recordings) and through rain, heat, snow and some pretty nasty hail storms, this remote has continuously worked flawlessly. The inside device sits on my kitchen counter yet doesn't overwhelm or become too conspicuous. I really would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Never registered outdoor temperature
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought worked ok inside but the outside temperature never registered. Kept it as had tossed the packaging and could use it for indoor temperatures. Purchased a 2nd one and once again the outside temperature didn't register. Called the company, went through the process to "reset" it and still never registered the outdoor temperature. Was told to purchase new batteries even though the 3 sets that I had tried were all brand new. This time I kept the packaging and returned it. Am now trying another brand, hopefully with better results.
customer_reviews.author: TJBush

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions for set-up carefully, use quality batteries.  Mine still failed.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the thermometer however the outdoor one could not keep it's batteries operating. The original pair I had worked very well for a long period of time. Then this Fall a squirrel knocked the outdoor one off the table causing it to come apart. Nothing was broken so I tried setting up the batteries again to no avail. So I replaced the batteries in both with new ones. That didn't seem to work so I gave up and ordered a new set of thermometers. These worked well for about a month then the outdoor one failed. New batteries worked for about 2 days. Now no reading from outside!. I've given up and will shop elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Fowles

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for Five Years Until a  Squirrel Attacked the Transmitter
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for five years. It only failed when an aggressive squirrel destroyed the outdoor transmitter. This is not La Crosse's fault. Ordered a replacement transmitter. Will see how it works, but so far this device has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller in person.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tiny. I was trying to replace a Lacrosse indoor outdoor click that is at least 5 times the size of this thing - very easy to read from across the room; this one, not so much. It appears much larger in the pictures here so check the measurements before you order.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ammerman

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for older people
customer_reviews.text: My mother in law is 93. We bought this for her and she was thrilled!! It is easy to read. She now had the time, inside & outside temperatures right by her chair. She's hard to buy for, but this was s hit! Now my husband wants one.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa K. Mcknight

customer_reviews.title: Died after 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: For the brief time it worked, it was good. It died 3 days after the Amazon return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: Geordie

customer_reviews.title: Good product. I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to read and temps are within half a degree of other therometes in the house. It did take a couple of hours when installed before everything settled down and temps began to match other readings both inside and outside.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: La Crosse ditigal temperature gauge not a best buy
customer_reviews.text: When unit is working it is great, just must be reset once or twice a day, this means taking the batteries out of both units, resetting, waiting 15 min. resetting time and putting them back, not something I enjoy doing so often. I do not recommend buying, I had another brand for four years before it went bad, I will purchase the other brand shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The product stopped working in November 2019 for some odd reason so I have been trying to get a replacement through Lacrosse since 11/26/19 to no avail. They never answer their phone and want to correspond over email and ask you the same questions over and over. Clearly a stall tactic. This is not an Amazon issue this is with the manufacturer. Do yourself a favor and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The panel is easy to read and I checked the temperature readings against ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for over 3 years and it works perfectly and correctly all the time. Battery life is long; I change them once a year before they run down. The panel is easy to read and I checked the temperature readings against an industrial thermometer and they are correct. Nice unit - takes up little space and I would recommend it to everyone looking for an indoor-outdoor temperature gauge
customer_reviews.author: RangerOne

customer_reviews.title: Bad on Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Liked the unit and it looked nice on table. Purchase June 21 2019 and I need to replace the outdoor unit Batteries . This will be the third set. I can not afford this ! Yes , I used top rated batteries from the start. Just wanted others to know .
customer_reviews.author: robert gillam

customer_reviews.title: a dud
customer_reviews.text: I had an older LL Bean branded La Crosse thermostat that lasted for well over 10 years. Finally bought this as a replacement, but it lasted less than a year. I don't know if they really went cheap on parts since then or if I just got a dud, but either way here I am out $20 with a thermometer that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: simpify wherever possible

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVER PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: Every thing worked fine when I set it up but after about 8 days the receiver would stop showing the outdoor temperature for several hours and then would work for a day or so then it would stop again. I bought this unit to replace the LaCrosse unit I had before--the transmitter on it went bad after several years. When I hooked up the new unit the old unit receiver started to work again. When the new receiver would go blank on the outdoor reading the old receiver would still show the correct reading and never went blank. The new receiver it still working but might not last very long. You can draw your own conclusions about this model.
customer_reviews.author: eng ret

customer_reviews.title: Company stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thermometer! The first one we received had a digital problem with a top number so I called and the company immediately sent me an entire unit replacement and it’s a great product. Very good company to work with. I didn’t have to send anything back and didn’t treat me like I was trying to put something over I them. I would not hesitate to order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit in 2013. It lasted until October 2017, so I decided to get another one (same unit). BAD CHOICE! The battery life on the new unit was poor and this week it died. I've done everything recommended and the outside sensor just doesn't work. So, I'll be purchasing a new unit, but not from LaCrosse Technology.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Serino

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 18 months
customer_reviews.text: The unit worked well when it worked, sensor on porch in shade, main unit on kitchen counter. After 18 months it stopped working completely. This type of device should work at least 5 years if not more. Definitely a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: KDBilly

customer_reviews.title: L@@K !! Both temps are displayed along with the time of day ...but only BRIEFLY !!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED review of this junk: After installation of new manufacturer-recommended batteries, the sensor seems to have lost its mind...Literally. No matter what one does, the sensor is unable to stabilize and provide the outdoor temperature...instead we have TWO LED LINES where the outdoor temp should display. Granted it's cheap enough one shouldn't grouse too much...but it's the principle: It shoul work...however, THIS product is a luck-of-the-draw purchase: You may get lucky and get a "good" unit, or you may get the "bad" unit...I suggest you do what we did: Look for something NOT manufactured by La Crosse NOT-SO-MUCH- Technology !!
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Maven

customer_reviews.title: La Crosse Honored their warranty
customer_reviews.text: After five months, the outside sensor got wet in a heavy rainstorm and stopped working. Fortunately, the one-year warrant was honored and La Crosse sent me a new remote sensor. The instructions do not stress that the remote sensor needs to be sheltered against moisture, but it clearly does need to be protected against wet conditions. I am very pleased with the support given by La Crosse (though it is a pain to have go through the process of trying to prove that the sensor no longer works). This is a no-frills model that I bought simply due to its larger LCD display that is easy to read from a distance (unless, of course, it's dark).
customer_reviews.author: G. Ellisberg

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrible product that does not last
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these over the last 3 years. This is a terrible product that does not last. I would suggest perhaps the La Crosse outside temp only on a kitchen window and combine that with the Marathon CL0300035 travel Atomic Alarm clock. We just got the Marathon and as advertised it took ours 48 hours to set but better than the combo temp La Crosse looks great but does not last. We have the La Crosse outside therm on our kitchen window ( not that secure in rain) and the Marathon Inside clock. Combining does not work for us
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Outside sensor is poor
customer_reviews.text: The outside sensor is garbage. The first one I purchased didn't work at all, which I returned. The second registers about 10 degrees too high. Unfortunately, this wasn't discovered until after the return period had closed. (It's used at a cottage, so it took us two trips to figure that out.) Do not purchase this!
customer_reviews.author: KJL

customer_reviews.title: all in all the best
customer_reviews.text: I did extensive research on several sites for the top indoor outdoor thermometer. This one kept coming up as in the top 5 list. No wonder! It really is great.
customer_reviews.author: kymarie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Readings ..
customer_reviews.text: Placed the sensor outside in the shade and the display inside the home. Works perfectly .. If it only had a humidity sensor, one could get a true feeling of what it feels like at a certain temp when exiting the house.
customer_reviews.author: CrazedMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Nice thermometer but defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Nice thermometer but defective out of the box. Easy to read and sets up easily. But it came defective. Indoor read out is 77.1 deg out of the box and has never changed-Defective. Over 2 weeks have gone by. Numerous calls never answered but messages left. They always promise to get back to you, and NEVER DO! Indoor temperature never worked out of the box. I've tried the manufacturer without success. I'll give them 2 more days and return it Amazon (which is a great company!).
customer_reviews.author: Journi

customer_reviews.title: Amended review: Failed in 10 months!
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Originally I gave this product a 2-star review because of the below (failed within one year). However, an email to La Crosse's customer service got me a reply that fixed the problem ("power issue": remove batteries for 2+ hours, replace batteries: worked). Except for this one glitch (no idea why it went blank, and that solution was not on their trouble-shooting page), this is a nice device. Nice design, good telemetry. However, in less than one year it has failed. Now the main base is dead (I changed batteries in both the base and the outdoor unit). Try something else!
customer_reviews.author: Rondodog

customer_reviews.title: Still works fine
customer_reviews.text: I can't remember when I bought this product but it's been many months and it still works fine.
customer_reviews.author: boss2u

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office and it is a great reference point for weather conditions inside and outside. The inside and outside temperatures seem to be exact and the product was easy to set-up and maintain.
customer_reviews.author: RCSK

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how it got good reviews. This is the second remote thermometer I ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. It only worked when the sensor was five feet away. In the same room it always read 2.5 degrees different when they should of read the same. It never worked through a window or wall. I don't know how it got good reviews. This is the second remote thermometer I have purchased and neither one worked, I don't believe the technology is there at least on these low end ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sojourner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t read outside temperature.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work after a couple of days put in a new battery and it worked for one day. I was out of state for two weeks now past the return date! Ugh!!😡 I need to update my review of this item. It didn’t work and amazon wouldn’t do a refund because of being past date but they did connect me with La Crosse Technology and they sent me a new unit!! I was very pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: La Crosse WS-9160U-IT In/Out Digital Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a accurate and simple indoor outdoor thermometer, this won't disappoint. It's easy to read from across the room, simple to use, and within a degree or two of our local weather forecaster. However this model does not have a back light if that's something you need.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

product_meta.title: La Crosse Technology Indoor/Outdoor Temperature WS-9160U-IT Digital Thermometer, Titianium
product_meta.description:
Color:Titianium

 LA CROSSE TECHNOLOGY WS-9160U-IT DIGITAL THERMOMETER WITH INDOOR/OUTDOOR TEMPERATURE
Extra Large Digits for Great Viewing! One of our Top Rated Thermometers makes this one of the Best Sellers! Wireless temperature transmits from weather resistant outdoor sensor, within 330 ft range and updates in 4 to 16 seconds depending on obstructions. 12 or 24 Hour manual setting time and will receive up to 3 outdoor sensors. Records MIN/MAX temperature values.

Desktop or Wall hang included TX29U-IT wireless temperature sensorView larger  EXTRA LARGE DIGITS
Outdoor temperature digits measure 1 inch tall for easy to read viewing. View up to 3 wireless sensors (sold separately) per indoor display. Monitor in different rooms, such as a basement, attic, greenhouse, garage, and so much more. Press CH (channel) for viewing specific sensor.

 WIRELESS TEMPERATURE
Receive wireless outdoor temperature from included transmitting sensor. Range from over 300 ft and is weather resistant from light moisture. Recommend placing transmitting sensor approximately 8 inches below under eave or overhang protected from consistent rain or snow and on the North side of home to protect from direct sunlight (best for accuracy. )

 MINIMUM/MAXIMUM VALUES
Indoor display records the highs & lows of both indoor & outdoor temperatures. Resetting is simple. 1) Press the MIN/MAX key once to display the min record. 2) Press and hold the MIN/MAX key again for about three seconds to reset all the minimum/ maximum data to the current temperature values

 MANUAL TIME
Quartz clock in 12 or 24-hour time display

measures 3.25in L x 0.85in W x 5.50in H - LCD 3.85L x 2 WView larger  ICON INDICATORS
Temperature station displays outdoor reception indicator (constant signal indicates strong connection), Low battery indicator for display (RX) or sensor (TX) when should need replacing. Sensor identification number is shown when more than one sensor is used.


 BENEFITS
 * Wireless IN/OUT Temp (F/C) 
 * MIN/MAX Value of Temp 
 * Can Receive Up to 3 Sensors 
 * 12/24 Hour Time Display (manual setting) 
 * 330 ft. transmission range 
 * OUT Temp Range: -39.8 F to +139.8 F (-39.9 C to 59.9 C) 
 * IN Temp Range: 14.2 F to 139.8 F (-9.9 C to 59.9 C) 
 * Receiver : 2 AAA Alkaline Batteries (not included) 
 * Sensor : 2 AA Alkaline Batteries (not included)
feature_bullets: Digital thermometer with wireless remote and clock.Display: 3.31" L x 0.89" W x 5.87" H,Sensor: 1.50" L x 0.83" W x 5.00" H
Remote sensor transmits from up to 330 feet; records daily high and low temperatures
Receives weather data from up to 3 sensors (other remotes sold separately)
Temperatures displayed in either Fahrenheit or Celsius; 12/24-hour time display
Display/receiver measures 5.86 by 3.3 inches inches; remote sensor: 5 by 1.5 inches
The outside transmitter takes 2 AA batteries
Mount the outdoor transmitter on a North-facing wall or in any well shaded area. Under an eave or deck rail is preferred.
The maximum transmitting range to the temperature station is over 330-feet (100 meters) in open air, not including walls

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars5,766 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Pack of 1 La Crosse Technology Indoor/Outdoor Temperature WS-9160U-IT Digital Thermometer, Titianium
